meanings.definition: A violent disturbance of the peace by a crowd
meanings.sent1: The riot in the city caused chaos and destruction.
meanings.sent2: The police were called to control the riot that broke out at the protest.
meanings.sent3: During the riot, someone started a food fight with bananas and apples.
meanings.sent4: The riot of colors in the painting captured everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The loud noises and screams made the riot unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A wildly uncontrolled or excited event
meanings.sent1: The children's birthday party turned into a riot of laughter and fun.
meanings.sent2: The concert turned into a riot when the band started playing the hit song.
meanings.sent3: The riot of bubbles from the bubble bath made the bathroom look like a foam party.
meanings.sent4: The riot of emotions in the movie made the audience cry and laugh at the same time.
meanings.sent5: The riot of flavors in the dish made it a culinary masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To take part in a riot
meanings.sent1: She decided to riot against the unfair treatment of workers.
meanings.sent2: The citizens rioted against the government's new policies.
meanings.sent3: The students planned to riot by organizing a peaceful protest.
meanings.sent4: The fans rioted outside the stadium after their team lost the championship.
meanings.sent5: The workers rioted for better wages and working conditions.
